title.narrative: SHRC-Support for women in border commune

description.narrative:
Project "Raising awareness and providing legal assistance in gender equality and families for women in border communes of Dong Thapprovince" contributes in: # Conducting capacity building, providing access and legal aid opportunities to ensure women's rights andgender equality in border communes. # Strengthening and expanding legal aid network in project areas # Encouraging stakeholders to share, link and operate effectively in legal support for women
Specific activities include: # Studying women and local officials' knowledge, attitudes and behaviors regarding gender equality and related laws # Collecting stories about gender equality and families in communities, selecting and turning these stories into communication materials. # Organizing consultation workshop on media content. Developing and publishing leaflets / brochures on gender equality to each family # Organizing communication sessions on gender equality and family for women aged 18-60 in 3 project communes. # Disseminating information on gender equality via districts' radio and television stations, social networks. # Organizing public speech contest from stories collected from the community # Organizing workshop to strengthen cooperation and coordination among parties in legal aid for women in border communes # Organizing trainings on communication skills and legal aid for female community leaders and advisory teams.

participating-org.narrative: An Giang Social Sciences and Humani Research Center (SHRC)

The center is a local-based research and development organization, a non-productive unit of An Giang University. The Center conducts research, application and transfer, training and training activities and scientific and technological services in the field of humanities and social sciences to meet the requirements of school development, socio-economic development in An Giang province, Mekong Delta provinces and social needs. The Center strives to become one of the leading research centers of the province and the region. The Center has organized science and technology activities to meet the development requirements of agencies, units and organizations within and outside the province such as: projects to build and implement models of community support (improving Vietnamese language for Khmer ethnic minority children with support from Khmer ethnic students, improving social psychological services for orphaned children infected with HIV / AIDS and children affected by HIV / AIDS through direct services andsocial work trainings, Strengthening understanding of preferential policies for disadvantaged students in order to repel corruption in education ...); conducting basic studies to support sectors, levels, agencies and organizations to develop and implementdevelopment policies, programs and plans (present conditions and solutions to decrease dropout rate, improve the quality of primary school teachers, the current situation and approach to education of Cham people, the demand for general teachers and vocational teachers, the current situations and solutions to the advancement of women, factors affecting women's participation in scientific research ...); national and international scientific conferences (social work and public health, sustainable poverty reduction, general education quality, child protection, care and education, transformation of family functions in the period of industrialization and modernization ...).

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
